author: n0price
content:
One question regarding signing the pre-exit and not submitting it.  It seems this is not possible to do if the validator is not active?
can you please confirm, and explain why is not possible to generate pre-exit of not yet active validators? thank you
 

```bash
teku voluntary-exit                                \
  --beacon-node-api-endpoint=http://127.0.0.1:5051 \
  --save-exits-path=.                              \
  --validator-keys=validator/keys/validator_1e9f2a.json:validator/passwords/validator_1e9f2a.txt
```

```bash
Loading configuration...
 - Loading network settings from http://11.255.111.23:5051/
Saving exits to folder ../exits, and not submitting to beacon-node.
Validator not found: 0xa7dbddfe8...eb4409d936516....
````

author: jgm
content: Validator exits use the validator index as part of the message.  If the validator is not yet on-chain it has no index, hence the message cannot be generated.
